info.name: HUST4L API Documentation #reference
info.description:
StartFragment

Sure, here's the **full English version of the API documentation overview** for your `HUST4L API Documentation #reference`, clean and professional ‚Äî ideal for devs, clients, or even public docs.

---

# üìò HUST4L API Documentation

Welcome to the official API documentation for **HUST4L**.

This API follows RESTful principles and provides a complete set of endpoints to manage authentication, users, content, SEO, services, and more.

---

## üîê AUTH - Authentication

> Handle user authentication and session-related actions. 
  

| Method | Endpoint | Description |
| --- | --- | --- |
| GET | `/me` | Get the currently authenticated user's info |
| GET | `/app-info` | Get app-level metadata |
| POST | `/login` | Log in a user and receive token/session |
| POST | `/update-password` | Change user password |
| POST | `/verify-code` | Verify OTP code (email, 2FA, etc.) |
| POST | `/logout` | Log out the current session |

---

## üë§ Users

> Manage users, their roles, and profile data. 
  

Includes endpoints for:

- Listing users
    
- Creating/updating/deleting users
    
- Changing roles or permissions
    

---

## üóÇÔ∏è Blog Category

> Manage blog post categories for filtering and organizing content. 
  

Typical use cases:

- Create, update, delete categories
    
- Assign categories to blog posts
    

---

## üìù Blog

> Manage all blog articles or CMS content. 
  

Includes:

- Create and edit blog posts
    
- Fetch all posts or filter by category/tag
    
- Get post detail by slug or ID
    

Supports both Markdown and HTML formats.

---

## üßæ Logs

> Track system or user actions for auditing and debugging. 
  

Useful for:

- Admin monitoring
    
- Viewing login history
    
- Logging API access or critical changes
    

---

## üõ†Ô∏è Service

> <p >Manage the list of services offered (useful for portfolios or agency websites).</p> 
  

Examples:

- Web design
    
- Branding / logo design
    
- SEO packages
    

Supports sorting and full CRUD.

---

## üì¨ Contact

> Handle contact form submissions or inquiries from the website. 
  

Features:

- Submit messages or requests
    
- Admin panel for viewing/responding
    
- Email notifications or auto-replies (optional)
    

---

## üîç SEO

> Manage SEO metadata for individual pages. 
  

Use to:

- Update meta title, description, and OG tags
    
- Apply SEO settings per slug or route
    

---

## ‚ùì FAQ

> Frequently Asked Questions section. 
  

CRUD for:

- Questions + Answers
    
- Tags or categories (if supported)
    

---

## üí∞ Pricing

> Manage pricing plans or service packages. 
  

Includes:

- Free / paid plans
    
- Feature descriptions
    
- Price, limits, and tiered access
    

---

## ü©∫ Health Check

> Check system status (used for CI/CD or monitoring tools). 
  

| Method | Endpoint | Description |
| --- | --- | --- |
| GET | `/health-check` | Check if the server and its dependencies are operational |

---

## ‚öôÔ∏è Technical Details

- **Authentication**: JWT or cookie-based sessions
    
- **Format**: All responses are in JSON
    
- **Status Codes**: Follows standard REST conventions (200, 201, 401, 403, 404, 500...)
    

---

## üß† Developer Notes

- Protected endpoints require valid JWT or session cookie
    
- Use `api-key: token` in headers for token-based auth
    
- Admin-only endpoints (if any) require `admin` or `superuser` roles
    

---

‚ö†Ô∏è All unauthorized attempts are logged.

Hack around ‚Äî and our DevOps team _will find you_. üòà

item.name: Blog Category

query.description:
Optional. A workspace ID in which to create the collection.

If you do not include this query parameter, the system creates the collection in your "My Workspace" workspace.

request.description:
Creates a collection using the [Postman Collection v2 schema format](https://schema.postman.com/json/collection/v2.1.0/docs/index.html). Include a `collection` object in the request body that contains the following required properties:

*   `info` ‚Äî An **object** that contains the following properties:
    *   `name` ‚Äî A **string** value that contains the collection's name.
    *   `schema` ‚Äî A **string** that contains a URL to the collection's schema. For example, the `https://schema.getpostman.com/collection/v1` URL.
*   `item` ‚Äî An **object** that contains the HTTP request and response information.
    *   `request` ‚Äî An **object** that contains the collection's request information. For a complete list of values, refer to the `definitions.request` entry in the [collection.json schema file](https://schema.postman.com/json/collection/v2.1.0/collection.json). If you pass an empty object for this value, the system defaults to an untitled GET request.

**Note:**

*   For a complete list of available property values for this endpoint, use the following references available in the [collection.json schema file](https://schema.postman.com/json/collection/v2.1.0/collection.json):
    *   `info` object ‚Äî Use the `definitions.info` entry.
    *   `item` object ‚Äî Use the `definitions.items` entry.
*   For all other possible values, refer to the [collection.json schema file](https://schema.postman.com/json/collection/v2.1.0/collection.json).

request.description: Gets information about a collection. For a complete list of this endpoint's possible values, use the [collection.json schema file](https://schema.postman.com/json/collection/v2.1.0/collection.json).
Deletes a collection.

Updates a collection using the [Postman Collection v2 schema format](https://schema.postman.com/json/collection/v2.1.0/docs/index.html). Include a `collection` object in the request body that contains the following required properties:

- `info` ‚Äî An **object** that contains the following properties:
    - `name` ‚Äî A **string** value that contains the collection's name.
    - `schema` ‚Äî A **string** that contains a URL to the collection's schema. For example, the `https://schema.getpostman.com/collection/v1` URL.
- `item` ‚Äî An **object** that contains the HTTP request and response information.
    - `request` ‚Äî An **object** that contains the collection's request information. For a complete list of values, refer to the `definitions.request` entry in the [collection.json schema file](https://schema.postman.com/json/collection/v2.1.0/collection.json). If you pass an empty object for this value, the system defaults to an untitled GET request.

**Note:**

- For a complete list of available property values for this endpoint, use the following references available in the [collection.json schema file](https://schema.postman.com/json/collection/v2.1.0/collection.json):
    - `info` object ‚Äî Use the `definitions.info` entry.
    - `item` object ‚Äî Use the `definitions.items` entry.
- For all other possible values, refer to the [collection.json schema file](https://schema.postman.com/json/collection/v2.1.0/collection.json).
    

### Important

Use caution when using this endpoint. The system will replace the existing collection with the values passed in the request body.

item.description: The `/contact` endpoints let you manage your [collections](https://learning.postman.com/docs/sending-requests/intro-to-collections/).

item.name: FaQ

request.description:
Creates a collection using the [Postman Collection v2 schema format](https://schema.postman.com/json/collection/v2.1.0/docs/index.html). Include a `collection` object in the request body that contains the following required properties:

*   `info` ‚Äî An **object** that contains the following properties:
    *   `name` ‚Äî A **string** value that contains the collection's name.
    *   `schema` ‚Äî A **string** that contains a URL to the collection's schema. For example, the `https://schema.getpostman.com/collection/v1` URL.
*   `item` ‚Äî An **object** that contains the HTTP request and response information.
    *   `request` ‚Äî An **object** that contains the collection's request information. For a complete list of values, refer to the `definitions.request` entry in the [collection.json schema file](https://schema.postman.com/json/collection/v2.1.0/collection.json). If you pass an empty object for this value, the system defaults to an untitled GET request.

**Note:**

*   For a complete list of available property values for this endpoint, use the following references available in the [collection.json schema file](https://schema.postman.com/json/collection/v2.1.0/collection.json):
    *   `info` object ‚Äî Use the `definitions.info` entry.
    *   `item` object ‚Äî Use the `definitions.items` entry.
*   For all other possible values, refer to the [collection.json schema file](https://schema.postman.com/json/collection/v2.1.0/collection.json).

response.name: Bad Request

query.description:
Optional. A workspace ID in which to create the collection.

If you do not include this query parameter, the system creates the collection in your "My Workspace" workspace.

Updates a collection using the [Postman Collection v2 schema format](https://schema.postman.com/json/collection/v2.1.0/docs/index.html). Include a `collection` object in the request body that contains the following required properties:

- `info` ‚Äî An **object** that contains the following properties:
    - `name` ‚Äî A **string** value that contains the collection's name.
    - `schema` ‚Äî A **string** that contains a URL to the collection's schema. For example, the `https://schema.getpostman.com/collection/v1` URL.
- `item` ‚Äî An **object** that contains the HTTP request and response information.
    - `request` ‚Äî An **object** that contains the collection's request information. For a complete list of values, refer to the `definitions.request` entry in the [collection.json schema file](https://schema.postman.com/json/collection/v2.1.0/collection.json). If you pass an empty object for this value, the system defaults to an untitled GET request.

**Note:**

- For a complete list of available property values for this endpoint, use the following references available in the [collection.json schema file](https://schema.postman.com/json/collection/v2.1.0/collection.json):
    - `info` object ‚Äî Use the `definitions.info` entry.
    - `item` object ‚Äî Use the `definitions.items` entry.
- For all other possible values, refer to the [collection.json schema file](https://schema.postman.com/json/collection/v2.1.0/collection.json).
    

### Important

Use caution when using this endpoint. The system will replace the existing collection with the values passed in the request body.
